page.title: 13RECREATION IN OLD BUCKENHAM
page.content: The main building for recreation in the village is the Village Hall which was opened in 1979. This is very well used by the community, from the Mother and Toddler Group to the Old Peoples' Luncheon Club. For the children there is a Playgroup three times a week and a Youth Club once a week for older children. Adults here have a lot of choice of organizations to join, including Flower Club, Carpet Bowls, Wine Circle, Theatrical Players and Womens' Institute. The Hall is hired out for discos, wedding receptions, special parties and occasional quizzes. There are weekly evening Bingo sessions as well as Keep Fit and a monthly clinic run by a Health Visitor. The Hall is used for fairs and fund-raising activities, particularly near to Christmas.
